facts.1: Proclaimed by the UN General Assembly with the idea that friendship can inspire peace efforts and build bridges between communities.
facts.2: First proposed in Paraguay in 1958 as 'International Friendship Day.'
facts.3: Emphasizes the involvement of young people in promoting international understanding and respect for diversity.

facts.1: Commemorates King Mohammed VI's ascension to the throne on July 30th, 1999.
facts.2: Marked by a royal speech, parades, and cultural events throughout Morocco.
facts.3: An occasion for the king to grant pardons and show generosity to the Moroccan citizens.

facts.1: A day to honor and express gratitude to fathers in the Dominican Republic.
facts.2: Involves family gatherings and the giving of gifts to fathers and father figures.
facts.3: Celebrated enthusiastically with special offers and themed advertising by businesses.
